column14: The Toselle Park Series - Book One
column17:
Why is every single one of Grace's romances a mess? Grace Nereid wasn't sure why her love life was constantly being thwarted, wondering what she had done in her past to deserve so much turmoil. Sure, she had her secrets, but it wasn't a good enough reason why at every opportunity something in her love life went wrong. Tired of the lies and deception from her emotionally abusive husband, Grace needs to take her life back but not before escaping to the Jersey shore.

However, nothing prepared her for the storm that was about to hit her. Jim Wooley, the one that got way was back in Toselle Park and divorced. Was it gravity that pulled them to each other? The storm of passion that raged under the surface for each other had been brewing for twenty-seven years and it was only a matter of time before it explodes around them. Weathering anything as long as they were together Grace and Jim had not expected that their past would collide with their present and dangerous waters lay dead ahead.
column18: When you get a second chance at your true love, no matter what threatens that happiness.
column23: emotional abuse, vehicular attempted murder, teenage emotional abuse

column17: Isla, a witch in the Kingdom of Adera, has been beaten, belittled, and punished all her life. Shunned and hidden inside the King's Coven with the other magic users, they are feared by the people of Adera. She works in the shadows to protect those she holds dear from the beasts of the land. Quinn, Adera's prince, is one of the few people outside the Coven to show Isla any kindness. However, when Isla finds herself imprisoned with her mysterious cell mate, V, secrets of the kingdom, and even herself are revealed.
column18: All that remains, is the monster you set free…
column23:
Recommended for 17+. This book contains themes of sexual assault, imprisonment, child abuse, slavery, suicidal thoughts and ideations, and genocide. Please take care of your mental health. If you are struggling with suicidal thoughts and ideations there are resources for you. You are not alone. 
988-Lifeline

column17:
Some Dreams don’t end when you wake up.
After their sister Mara’s death…
Eli wakes night after night, drenched in sweat, haunted by dreams too vivid, too violent to ignore. Dreams where something ancient crawls through the cracks in reality. Something watching, waiting. Something called the Bender.
When his younger brother Noah begins sketching the same entity Eli sees in his sleep, grotesque, shifting, wrong, Eli knows the nightmares are not just in his head. Noah does not speak of what he draws. He does not have to. The Bender is no longer confined to dreams.
She is walking now.
And she is coming for them.
Their Aunt Colleen, the last of a family line bound to a secret ritual, holds the key to understanding the creature’s return, and the price required to stop her. But as reality fractures and time begins to unravel, Eli must face a terrifying truth:
Not every nightmare ends in sleep.
column18: Ignite the nightmare fuel with book one in the The Bender Saga.
column23: Unsettling imagery, body horror, emotional trauma, violence

column17:
Fletcher is a member of The Hunter’s Guild, an elite group of monster hunters who protect the world of Felheim. When he wins a lucrative assignment, he must travel to the distant island of Sparthos at the behest of a king. However, details of the hunt are scarce. He only knows that he must recover a mysterious treasure from a labyrinth that lies beneath a castle.

Joining Fletcher on this quest are his two companions: Rose, his flirtatious best friend; and Onyx, a giant of a man with a Devotion to strength. During their journey, the trio faces deadly trials, and even deadlier monsters. All the while Fletcher battles with his growing feelings for Rose, because for him, love comes with a cost.

Upon reaching Sparthos, the hunters discover that not everything is as it appears. Dark secrets begin to unravel under the facade of the island kingdom. Secrets that could threaten all of Felheim.
column18: A trio of monster hunters embark on a quest to recover a treasure from a Labyrinth.
column23: Violence

column17:
Sixteen-year-old Marcus Talent is used to facing challenges—he’s been physically disabled since he was
nine years old. The most exciting thing that’s happened in his life is meeting the pretty new neighbor, Sadie.
When he wakes up in another world in the middle of the night and is nearly killed before waking up back in his
own bed, his father tells him the power to travel in his sleep to Lysomnus is a Talent family trait. Eager to learn
more the next morning, Marcus is devastated when he wakes up and discovers his father is missing.
Desperate, Marcus enlists the help of Sadie and his best friend Leopold to help him find his way back to
Lysomnus and accidentally takes them with him. Together, they traverse the landscape of this beautiful
new world and make new friends while searching for Marcus’s father. Marcus finds himself feeling things he
never has before—power, betrayal, and a whole lot of attraction for the beautiful girl next door.
column18: When disabled Marcus Talent  learns he has a genetic gift for traveling to another world, he must travel there with his friends to find his kidnapped father and use his newfound power to save an entire world.
column23: None

column17:
I wasn't looking for a savior. I was just trying to breathe.
I was just trying to breathe.

But Callum Devlin didn't come to save me.
He came to ruin everything that ever tried to keep me caged.
Raised in the shadows of my father's empire, I was born into silence and control.
Then Callum showed up-dark eyes, rough hands, and a stare that cut me open.
He saw something in me I'd buried deep.
And he didn't just want it. He claimed it.
Now, my past is unraveling. My mother's ghost claws at the cracks, and the man I should run from is the only one I trust when everything goes to hell.
This isn't just a love story, it's an obsession.
And I don't know if we'll make it out whole-but I know we'll make it out bloody.
A dark romance full of trauma, teeth, and twisted devotion.
The Ruin That Loves Me will grab you by the throat and whisper, "You were always mine."
column18: “I was taught to curtsy with the same hands I later used to slit a man’s throat”
column23: Violence & torture, psychological trauma, threats of sexual assault, human trafficking & captivity, experimentation & bodily autonomy, on page death

column17: Kara has been running for nearly four decades. First, from her elven heritage, then from her beloved assassin family after an assignment goes sideways and she is left for dead. But when the Demigods threaten to obliterate Cylendri in a power play for the throne, Kara must finally face her past. As her lives collide, she journeys North with her friend & mentor, gathering unlikely heroes from across the Factions to prevent global destruction. To save Cylendri and all who call it home, Kara must atone for abandoning the Vipers, protect a forgotten connection, reconcile with her family, and master a dangerous magical mutation before it kills her. The fate of the world hangs in the balance as she defies her demons, embraces her full power, and prepares for a sacrifice she never imagined. But saving the world is only the beginning, because nothing is ever that simple.
column18: At the junction of who she was and who she is, an elven assassin on the run must defy her demons, confront her past, and embrace her full power in time to save a world on the brink of destruction.
column23: Violence, profanity

column17:
Karver

Life has taught me that we all wear masks. Some for protection. Some to hide their true selves; be that good, bad and in between. Everybody lies and everybody leaves, that much I know is true. Nana always said I would know when I found the one. That I could wholly and unapologetically be my true self with them. When lies, deception and manipulation are tactics I've perfected to protect myself and my heart, how do I convince Sloane that my love for her is real? Deep within my tangled web of lies that suffocates her is my one kernel of truth. She's my 143.

Sloane

Nothing. All that I feel and all that I am, amounts to absolutely nothing. When your father abandons you and your mother screams at you that you have no right to cry over her heartbreak, you learn to shut it all off. Even in the face of something that should cause me insurmountable grief, I feel nothing. Does that make me broken or a monster? Perhaps, I'm both. Or so I thought. Karver came crashing into my pathetic existence and gave it meaning. Feeling. The floodgates opened and he kickstarted my heart back to life. But there's a balance in this thing called life. The good with the bad. The joy with the sorrow. And the sweet smiles followed by salty tears. What's worse... I've fallen in love with the suspect of multiple murders. Is he broken or a monster? Perhaps, he's both.
column18: Toxic love in a psych ward with a side of murder mystery
column23: Your mental health is important. This is NOT a happy, cute love story. It is a dark book with a lot of anguish and gore. Please be honest to yourselves and mind the triggers. Trigger Warnings Body Horror Stalking Self-Harm Mention of Suicidal Ideations Graphic Sexual Situations Necrophilia Bloody Heart Sex Toy Murder Stabbing Mention of Psychiatric Symptoms Knife Play Blood Play Masks Gore Intense Emotional Volatility Use of Drugs and Alcohol Suicide Hanging Strangulation Drug Overdose Forced Drug Use Isopropanol Poisoning Head Injury Blunt Force Trauma Smothering Desecration of Remains Bodily Fluids Exhibitionism Voyeurism

column17:
Felicity Reid's life is a whirlwind of high-stakes litigation at one of New York City's top law firms. Her career demands every ounce of her dedication, leaving no room for love or intimacy. Determined to make partner before thirty, Felicity has accepted a life of solitary ambition.

Everything changes when she meets Lance, the Sergeant At Arms in a notorious bikie gang, at a charity gala. Their one-night stand ignites a passionate affair, one that must remain a secret from her bosses at all costs. But when a brutal murder leads to Lance's arrest, Felicity's world is turned upside down.

Assigned to defend Lance, she is thrust into a dangerous mission where the stakes are life or death. As she delves deeper into the murky underworld of gangs and violence, Felicity must navigate treacherous waters, battling against time and powerful enemies to save the man she's falling for.

"Hard Time" is a relentless thriller, weaving a tale of passion, betrayal, and survival. Every twist and turn plunges Felicity deeper into a perilous struggle, where one wrong move could destroy everything. In this high-octane race, she must decide how far she's willing to go to save Lance—and herself.
column18: Elite lawyer’s secret fling with a biker killer turns deadly—one wrong move in his murder defense, and she’s dead.
column23: Abuse, drug use, kidnapping, attempted SA

column17: In 19th century, the city got infected by disease called ‘The hidden’. The hidden isn’t a deadly disease, it's making the people remain silent for the rest of their life, and 'The hidden' disease only affects the people at age of 30. The council decided to build a robot to help them to find the cure, but a child named Ren discovered a secret behind this disease. in this story, we will follow Ren in his journey, and we will see how he discovered the secret, and how the council built the robot. And what will happen if the child and the robot meet on the same road.
column18: ‘ It was a rainy day, the sunrise vanished from the sky, and the flower remained silent. The soul was infected by the disease, and the people wondered when that day would end. My name is Ren, and this is my diary. I will share with you what happened and how the city was destroyed.’
column23: Normal fight and death that does not contain any torture
column25: I did not have kobo because my book is on Kindle unlimited

column15: Romance, Dark Romance, Fantasy, Thriller, Paranormal
column17:
She was never meant to live forever. A pact forged at the dawn of creation binds her to the Devil himself—his hunger, his desire, his endless obsession. Promised eternity and power, Eden becomes his instrument of bloodshed, condemned to slaughter in his name across the ages.

Their bond is a tangled web of love and manipulation, passion and control. But when a new force rises—one who awakens something long buried within her—Eden is torn between the seductive embrace of her dark lover and the forbidden pull of the man sworn to end her existence.

In a tale of sin and salvation, power and passion, The First Sin is a dark, seductive journey where the damned have their own plans… and immortality comes at a price. Will love be enough to break the chains of fate, or will the shadows claim her forever?
column18: The first vampire and mankind’s original sin, the devil whose obsessed with her and the angel liking to fall to save her.
column23: Morally gray characters and themes that challenge religious beliefs, Graphic depictions of violence, death, and sex.

column17: This book is filled with lots of heartfelt poetry, from anger, depression, sadness, and some happiness. Please enjoy, and maybe some of these poems will even touch your heart!
column18: Emotional poetry to make you feel seen
column23: Profanity

column17: This first book of poetry will touch your heart in ways you never thought possible.
column18: Heartfelt poetry
column23: Some profanity

column17:
Guided by the wise mage Matrum Tanarum and joined by loyal companions, he embarks on a desperate quest to find the lost Vales—ancient sites of power that are the world’s only hope against a rising tide of darkness. That darkness has a name: Empress Telgress. Forging an empire from the ashes of her hatred, she seeks to eradicate Elven culture and twist the world's Deep Magic to her will. But even her immense power is just a shadow of the ancient evil that guides her hand: a malevolent entity named Aesthalis.

Their journey takes them across treacherous seas and into the unforgiving Sands of Morgran, a desert that hides one vale Telgress has pointed them toward. But in a world where alliances are as shifting as the desert sands, a devastating betrayal that leaves their fellowship broken shatters their quest . William and the fierce ranger Altanie must flee, leaving their friends to an unknown, brutal fate.

Now isolated and hunted, William and Altanie must press on alone into the heart of the corrupted Valley of Glass, a place of shattered memories and nightmarish trials designed to break their spirits. Here, they will discover the true nature of the enemy—not just an Empress bent on revenge, but a cosmic chaos that seeks to unmake reality itself. Can their bond withstand a power that feeds on despair? And with their allies captured or lost, can two heroes stand against a darkness that consumes even emperors?

The balance of the world is breaking. One hero must rise, or everything will fall.
column18: The last of a forgotten Elven bloodline, William Carelock carries a burden heavier than any sword: the Oracle Stone.
column23: No Warning. Just Adventure

column14: It’s part of a series (not written yet) but can be read as a standalone
column17:
Raelynn Occishian was only eight when fire stole her parents and left her branded insane. For ten long years, she’s been trapped inside white asylum walls, her only comfort her best friend Lisa. But when a hidden iron door reveals a prisoner with icy blue eyes—and a past soaked in blood—Raelynn makes the one choice that shatters her reality.

Now Lisa is missing. The Fae realm Lisa always whispered about is real. And to survive it, Raelynn must become the weapon her father trained her to be. Her first step? Enrolling in the infamous Noctis Academy for Assassins, where every trial is deadly, allies turn traitor, and monsters lurk in the shadows.

Bound to the Shadow Serpent—an assassin as dangerous as he is intoxicating—Raelynn is dragged into a web of betrayals, forbidden magic, and a war that could consume both realms. She has a king to kill. A crown to take. And a darkness inside her that refuses to stay buried.
column18: From an asylum to a court of assassins, drowned in betrayals and lies, a broken girl must become a terrifying weapon …or be destroyed.
column23: imprisonment/asylum references, violence, execution, torture (referenced), war themes, psychological trauma, manipulation, betrayal.

column17:
In a land divided by centuries of war and distrust, an elven princess and a human prince are the last hope for peace — or the spark that ignites another war.

Princess Elissa of Treiaul has never fit the mold of royal perfection. She prefers the forest to the throne room, her bow to the delicate trappings of court life. But when Prince Hayward of Aasleagh arrives to negotiate a fragile peace treaty, she’s ordered to play the gracious host to the human she’s been raised to despise.

Hayward is no stranger to being underestimated — the youngest of his brothers and a seasoned soldier, he’s spent his life carving out a place for himself. He enters elven territory with low expectations and party of men mostly chosen by his father who he doesn’t trust, prepared to endure the cold shoulder of a princess who sees him as the enemy.

But what neither of them anticipates is the undeniable pull between them. Their sharp words turn into lingering glances, and every clash of wills ignites something far more dangerous than hatred. As their chemistry simmers, Hayward becomes the unexpected catalyst for Elissa to embrace her wild heart and for her people to see the looming human threat for what it truly is.

With tensions rising and kingdoms on the brink of war, their forbidden connection might either shatter the fragile hope of peace — or forge a love powerful enough to change the fate of their realms forever.

This romantasy debut is a tale of passion, prejudice, and the power of choosing love in a world that demands war.
column18: A spicy instalust romantasy where the spark between them will either unite their kingdoms or bring the war that’s been brewing for decades.
column19: Cultural / ethnic diversity, Neurodivergent rep, Mental health themes
column23: Violence, death, murder, hunting, minor gore

column17:
A dark fantasy romance of captivity, power, and forbidden love.

When humanity fell to the Covart-Virus, Dr. Melodie Jaxxon became the humanity’s last hope. But one mistake tore her from her world and delivered her into captivity by an Awyan — a commander of an ancient race of elves who see her as property, not salvation.

Now bound to a ruthless warlord who renames her Allora, she must fight to survive the gilded prison of his desire — and uncover the truth about the soulbond that ties them.
column18: Free Black Canary: An enemies-to-lovers elven fantasy romance of obsession and power.
column23: Captivity, explicit sex, violence and blood but minimal, slavery, themes of black oppression
column29: Black Herione, Autistic coded MMC, BWWM, OCD MMC

column14: It will be part of a series but as of right now it is my debut!
column17:
Elves have always considered humans to be a threat to their abilities and civilization.

That’s why Lady Helena of the Court of Phantasm, has ordered three of her trusted elves to enter the human realm and discover the truth. Leaving their realm of Veayneri, they’ll use their ability to cast illusions and disguise themselves as humans to gain the answers they’re looking for.

Stella Riverstone, is a twenty-eight year old woman who finds herself in a cafe meeting a grumpy gentleman named Blaise, whom she anxiously requests to work for. Uncertain as to why Blaise took such an interest in her, she hesitantly agrees to celebrate the Halloween season together and even help bake for a party Blaise insists they host.

When Stella pushes through her writhing anxiety and confesses her feelings to Blaise, she faces his harsh rejection. She struggles to comprehend it all because it seemed like he wanted her as much as she did him.

Elven and human relationships are forbidden. Blaise’s past once taught him the consequences of that. Of a life lost; but not an elves. With the laws now changed, it is a “cruel fate,” as Lady Helena would say.

To be caught in love with a human, is to be sentenced to a life in prison until the human they love passes on.
column18: If I had read Lady Helena’s journal of her feelings for Abigail, perhaps I could have found a way to prevent myself from falling in love with a human and avoid prison.
column23: Abandonment trauma, abuse from family members (mostly described in the past for characters but may have some instances shown), small moment of character stalking the fmc and is later mentioned (not done by the mmc), some gore descriptions and blood, panic/anxiety attacks, sexual abuse trauma from past relationship (not between the fmc and mmc, but they do talk about it), struggles with sexual intimacy, grief, loss, tragic death, murder (In the past in their fantasy realm, Veayneri), explicit sexual content.

column17: When three women are found murdered, FBI Agent Jakes finds one common link—they have all attended Kristina Truly’s relationship workshops. As Jakes hunts the serial killer, keeping Kristina safe becomes just as important as solving the case. Between the humor of unlikely allies, the heat of undeniable chemistry, and the shadow of a deadly threat, every clue brings them more danger than answers. In the world of love, betrayal and murder, one wrong move could be fatal.
column18: She’s looking for Mr. Right—Mr. Wrong’s killing to stop her.
column23: Kidnapping, mature language,

column17:
As princess of Sunfall, Adelaide faces more than threats of marriage and stuffy dresses. As secondary heir to a distinguished lineage blessed by the gods themselves, she lives with the crushing reality that the divine powers that be skipped over her. Her father and brother wield divine light as easily as some breathe, imbuing their weapons and armor with protections against the vampires that loom beyond the kingdom walls.

At twenty-six, the only thing saving Adelaide from a life of marriage and death by childbirth is her keen skills with a sword, whose imbued steel has propelled her to the top of her kingdom’s ranks and earned her a reputation of skill and prowess with her soldiers. She knows her life will find its end in the clutches of some beast’s fangs on the battlefield, just as her mother was claimed by them sixteen years ago.

With King Alaric’s power waning and her brother’s inability to produce an heir, Adelaide finds herself on the chopping block. Even the chance of producing an heir that can wield the divine light of Siralto puts her on the nobles’ radar. Powerless, she’s never going to escape the fate she tried so hard to ignore.

But all this changes the day her brother-in-law returns home from war. The problem? Only Shadow Folk come back from the dead. And if Finch is alive, well, and within their walls, it’s only a matter of time before the Shadow King himself comes to claim the vengeance he’s sought for almost two decades. Adelaide is powerless to stop him.


Or is she?

Magic Bites is the first in the Tales of the Shadow Folk. Perfect for fans of dark, epic romantasies with slow burn, enemies-to-lovers romances, Magic Bites has plenty of twists and turns in store. Do you dare to fight back against the Shadow Folk? Or will you, too, be swept away by sweet, simmering lies and sultry fangs?
column18: Forgotten by the gods, Adelaide forges her power in the sweet judgment of the sword — her only weapon against the shadow folk that would burn her kingdom to ashes and feast upon its people.
column23: Murder, violence, discussions of child loss/fertility struggles (nothing graphic or detailed on page for this)

column17:
(I just realized Magic bites is not eligible for a free promo til end of January, so I’m submitting this one instead — so sorry about that! Misread the date it renews in Jan) 

From the moment she was born, Clarisse Monroe was able to create and command stars—a skill that perturbed her parents and landed her in a cult to cleanse her of her forbidden yet divine gift.

After years of being forced to shut away her powers and pretend to be a normal child, she is tired. That is, until the Shadow Reaper arrives. Terrence whispers promises to her: promises of freedom, magic, and power beyond her wildest dreams. All she has to do is embrace the same light she’s closed off in her veins, guarding it from the view of other mortals.

Spurred to action, she begins to forge a life for herself beyond the clutches of the Church of Light and her greedy parents. As she leans into her power, she discovers some uncomfortable truths about Terrence and the real consequences of magic.

With the Grim Reaper now lurking in the shadows, begging her to stop, she realizes that her newfound freedom and friendship come at a cost. Now, she must ask herself: is magic worth dying for?

Fans of grimdark fantasy will love Remember the Stars, the first in the Tales of the Selyento, a series about what it means to be blessed by gods long forgotten and hunted by monsters that lurk beyond the grave.
column18: Divine light is forbidden in the hands of mortals. To use it is to condemn oneself to death and damnation.
column23: Child abuse, violence, dark themes of mental health struggles, major character death

column17:
Decon De Alcázar, once known as the Blood-Forged General, bound himself in silver and entombed his own body beneath a Spanish monastery to prevent a war that would have destroyed the world. For over a century, his name was erased, his legend reduced to whispers.

In modern-day Seville, a woman known only as White Lotus rules the city’s underworld with calm authority and ruthless precision, unaware that her fate is tied to ancient sigils long buried beneath the streets she controls.

When a dormant sigil awakens, it shatters the seal meant to keep Decon forgotten and sends shockwaves through the vampire court. As old powers move to contain the threat, Decon rises, not as a savior or a monster, but as a force that refuses to kneel.

Bound together by a sigil forged through love, blood, and sacrifice, Decon and Lotus ignite a dangerous, irresistible connection, one that threatens centuries of vampire rule and forces Lotus to choose between the destiny written for her, or the power to rewrite it.

The Sigil’s Mark is a dark, seductive vampire romance filled with ancient magic, forbidden devotion, and bite of heat. Perfect for readers who love morally powerful heroes, fearless heroines, and love that defies empires.
column18: He bound himself in silver to keep the world safe, she awakens the sigil that craves him, and when an ancient vampire god collides with a woman who refuses to kneel, desire becomes the deadliest form of power.
column23:
This book contains adult themes intended for mature readers, including:
	•	Explicit sexual content and open-door intimacy
	•	Power imbalance dynamics between immortal beings and humans
	•	Dark romantic themes and morally complex characters
	•	Violence, bloodshed, and graphic combat scenes
	•	Emotional trauma, captivity, and imprisonment
	•	References to manipulation, coercion, and psychological control
	•	Death and discussions of mortality
	•	Themes of obsession, possession, and devotion
	•	Supernatural elements involving vampires, ancient magic, and blood rituals

Reader discretion is advised.

column12: Celestine: a 1900s Parisian Christmas Fairy Tale
column17:
The Courtesan Who Came to Christmas Dinner… and Changed Everything.

Christmas in Paris, 1900. Beneath the glittering lights of the World’s Fair and the velvet haze of the Palais Rose, Celestine reigns as the most enchanting courtesan in the city—desired, celebrated, and hopelessly trapped in a life she never truly chose.

Adrien Louis, a grieving widower and wealthy merchant, has closed his heart to the world. His cold Parisian townhouse mirrors the life he leads—silent, empty, untouched since the tragedy that shattered him four years ago.

When a pair of noisy sisters in the neighboring townhouse set their sights on the handsome Monsieur Louis, he makes a desperate, almost absurd, decision: he hires Celestine to pose as his companion for Christmas dinner.

What begins as a convenient arrangement soon reveals unexpected truths. Behind Celestine’s shimmering façade is a woman yearning for freedom. Behind Adrien’s sorrow lies a man still capable of profound love.

As Paris glows with holiday magic and Christmas cheer, an unlikely connection sparks, one that neither of them believes they deserve, yet both are powerless to resist.

But love in the City of Light has a way of exposing everything: longing, fear, hope… and the courage to imagine a different life.

A Parisian fairytale of passion, heartbreak, and second chances, Celestine will sweep you into a world where even the coldest hearts can be warmed, and the most dazzling courtesan may become the heroine of her own story.
column18: A Moulin Rouge inspired fairy tale about a coveted courtesan accompanied a grieving widower to Christmas dinner and find redemption from misery.
column19: Cultural / ethnic diversity, Mental health themes
column23: Suicidal ideation, grief, sexual exploitation, sex worker

column17:
Lotus Everett was dealt a cruel hand that trapped her in an eternal existence. With her twin brother’s demons never too far away, she takes a chance to flee from his torment to the other side of the country, to Fairhaven, Washington, one of the first towns to embrace the treaty between humans and vampires.

Situated with a new identity, a home, and two close friends, Lotus finally gets a taste of what it feels like to be ordinary.

Until he sees her.

Silas Clark is no stranger to a good time. He’s just not looking for any attachments while he and his brother work on building Little Wing, a community center for young vampires. But when he sees a mysterious woman who appears to be concealing her vampirism, he won’t stop until he uncovers what lies beneath her façade.

When he learns all that lies beneath, will he still look at her the same way? Or will he turn on her just like the rest?
column18: “I couldn’t ignore that he reminded me what it was to be alive.”
column23: Consumption of blood, physical and emotional violence, alcohol consumption, coarse language, open-door consensual intimate scenes, Implied Incest (Luca’s very unrequited feelings), Brief mention of animal passing (Horse. Off-page)

column17:
In the year 3197 AD, humanity has reached the stars and has terraformed and colonized a small section of the Milky Way. It has been 6 years since the end of the Isolde Revolution, a war that split humanity into two political blocs at the cost of hundreds of millions of lives. The Federation of Human Planets licks its wounds and tries to adapt after a third of its population broke away. The Independent Frontier Systems Alliance, IFSA, desperately rebuilds its devastated worlds with a shaky economy that can't survive another war.

Erina and her sister Ashley were living a simple life when they came across an interesting job opportunity for both of them aboard a ship to work as freighters. The sisters meet the owners of the ship, two cousins and veterans of the Isolde Revolution. The tall cousin, Francis, is the captain and owner of the freight business. A man with charisma and a big smile, he leads the crew of Silver Bow. The other cousin, Charlie, is the taciturn first officer haunted by his past and the betrayal that almost killed him three years before.

While the crew restores Silver Bow to get it flight ready, they learn to work with each other and their various personalities, but they discover that a local mafia boss has other plans, and their safety and lives hang in the balance.
column18: To be a good protector, you must be willing to be a monster.
column19: Disability representation, Cultural / ethnic diversity, Mental health themes, LGBTQIA+, Other (please specify)
column23: Graphic violence, some gore, suicidality, sexual content, child exploitation, threats of SA

column17:
Silver Bow is finished and finally underway to start its journey as a freighter, and although Charlie is initially in a good mood, his demeanor sours and gets worse. Eri tries to get to the bottom of it, but he continues to push her and the rest of the crew away.

Ash and Francis begin to feel drawn to each other, but Francis’ feelings towards his estranged wife continue to keep him away from the security officer, and Kai is unfortunately often caught in the middle.

While the crew begin to work jobs, something brews in the Federation. Tristan, Charlie’s brother in the FIA, has developed a plan to capture Charlie. He has developed a team to do it, and it may have something to do with what Charlie finds on a derelict ship out in deep space.
column18: Out in deep space, a signal awaits
column19: LGBTQIA+, Disability representation, Mental health themes, Cultural / ethnic diversity, Other (please specify)
column23: Graphic violence, some gore, SA, child abuse and exploitation, cannibalism, suicidality

column17:
After losing her mother, Scarlet Bowen is forced to start over in NYC with her family.
At Hudson College, she finds peace on the basketball court, but tension in the eyes of Miles Grove, the grumpy team captain who's all in from the start.
As Scarlet battles for her place on the team, she faces a jealous ex, a step-father set on stealing her future, and the fear that love might cost her everything. When Miles betrays her trust, it nearly breaks her but real love doesn’t walk away.
With the national championship on the line, Miles will do whatever it takes to earn her forgiveness and prove she’s stronger than she ever knew, especially by his side.
column18: Scarlet just wants to win her title but who can she really trust?
column23: Swearing,  Mental health, fun use and knife use, attempted murder, assault, both verbal and emtional abuse, sexual content

column17:
Arlee Keller has been forced to live in her gilded cage. Forced to marry a monster by her parents for money and now bound to someone who controls everything she has left. Every smile is a lie, every breath a gamble. The only light left in her world is her daughter, Gracie.

But one whispering wish changes everything…

When Gracie climbs onto Santa’s lap and wishes for her mother’s happiness, Ace doesn’t just listen, he acts. One reckless decision, one dangerous promise, and suddenly Arlee and Gracie are gone… hidden away in the arms of the man who would burn the world to save them.

But safety doesn’t last forever.

Henry Kalven isn’t a man who forgives and forgets, and Christmas lights can’t outshine the darkness chasing them.

Now Arlee must fight the nightmare she escaped, and Ace will discover how fast he will flip his world upside down for the only angel he’s ever loved.
column18: One Christmas wish. One deadly rescue. And a past that refuses to be buried
column23: Abuse (all types), Mentions of suicide (minimal), Cheating, Childhood and on page trauma, Gore, killing, death and torture, eyeballs, eye sockets, and other bodily organs (briefly in torture scene), sexual language and explicit scenes, kidnapping and abduction,  morally grey characters,  mentions of organised crime.

column17:
The McCarthy family is one of the most powerful families in the Irish mob, and they rule Chicago as one of three crime factions. There has been tension between the Irish and the Italians for as long as Callum can remember, though the specifics of when the feud started are speculative at best. He had always known that he would either have to clean up a mess between the families or take a bullet to keep the peace.

That bullet aimed for his chest came disguised as a woman named Serafina Costa, the daughter of the head of the Italian mafia. When a marriage pact is proposed and agreed upon for the second time, Callum knows he can’t let his family back down without cause. Serafina has the reputation of a goddamned saint. Getting out of the wedding isn’t possible, so instead he approaches her and offers a different kind of deal.

Marriage, with heirs, and an eventual payout with the promise of a clean divorce and the freedom to do whatever, and whoever, she pleases during their time together. Callum needs to continue his family name, and Sera needs to do as her father demands to keep her head on her shoulders. It was a business deal, a contract… he was never supposed to fall in love with her. The best laid plans, though….
column18: The Irish mob and the Itialian Mafia attempt to end a blood war with a marriage, but when her secrets come out, everything changes.
column23: Abuse, Trauma, light BDSM, violence, bodily injury.

column17:
Cattian Mastman finds herself having to flee from her childhood home when she is betrothed to a man she could never love. He is cruel and twisted, and she desires adventure on the open ocean. Her father was a notorious pirate captain that was murdered when she was a child, and she has wanted nothing more in her life than to take up his legacy and find her own story to tell.

When her boots hit the deck of his Wave Walker, she is handed over to two pirate brothers that have been tasked with making her into a sailor worthy of her father's name. As she learns to survive, she begins to uncover secrets her father left behind for all of them.

A hidden treasure, priceless beyond all measure, is waiting for them. They just need Catt to crack her father's old code and lead them to it.

In a thrilling tale of adventure, grief, rebellion, and piracy, Catt finds her own family among her new crew as she picks up her father's mantle on her quest to become The Black Catt.
column18: A lady raised for high society follows in the footsteps of her pirate captain father into a world of the unknown on the high seas.
column23: Grief and trauma from loss is heavy throughout all 12 books in this series.
column29: Grief is a heavy theme throughout the series. Female empowerment, female leadership, smashing the patriarchy.

column17:
Red River Ranch is nestled in the heart of Falls County, Texas, where Oakley Young works the family ranch ever since she was kicked off the rodeo team and her parents pulled her out of college. It wasn’t the best year of her life, but it was worth it. Instead of becoming the rodeo champion she always wanted to be, now she works cattle and helps manage the ranch. Not a bad trade, if you ask her.

She has been on again, off again with the Ranch Manager, Logan James. It’s a mutually beneficial arrangement at this point where they both get something they need from the other. When that line starts to blur, and emotions start to get involved when Logan gets some bad news from home, they have to change the rules of their game.

Strange things start happening around the ranch, the town, and the local rodeo. From a rock going through Oakley’s back door, her gear being tampered with, and vandalism there are a world of red flags out there.
column18: When his boss' daughter is in danger from a stalker, he steps in to handle business the way he handles the ranch.
column23: Addiction, stalking, relationship trauma, family trauma.

column12: Acid: book one of the Obsidian Alchemy Trilogy
column17:
Bleeding, breeding and feeding.
These are the only 3 things humans are deemed fit for after a virus overtakes the world and divides the predator from the prey. 
The prey-Theo, Stud #22310, a breeding camp slave whose so encumbered in darkness it’s threatening to swallow him whole the night an unexpected friend helps him to escape 
The predator-Zelda Amdis, the ice-hearted heir apparent to the North American continent and bastard born daughter of Emperor Cree Amdis, direct descendant to the dark mother who blessed their kind with the virus and its dark divinity 
One has never had the luxury of choice while the other is the reason why. 
A tragic encounter will suddenly leave them tethered to one another. A once ancient manifestation thought to only exist between those blessed by the virus. However Theo threatens to challenge everything Zelda has known of her kind for over 300 years. 
As tensions mount and a bloodied murder sends them unexpectedly on the run for their lives they will both have to learn the hard way what it feels like to be the hunted in a predators world
column18: Bleeding, breeding, feeding
column23:

Gore

Themes of rape/non consensual breeding

column17:
A group of friends try to save one of their own from being used by sinister forces from their past. While on the run, they find out that this is all part of a larger scheme by a psychotic madman who would rewrite all of creation in his image. Meanwhile, they are hounded by a cyborg assassin driven by a warped sense of justice.

Led by a grumpy old professor and his grumpier old dog, the group looks for the lost journal of a long-dead seer who foresaw everything, and whose predictions hold the key to stopping the destruction of all that is. They just have to survive long enough to find it.
column18: A group of friends work with a grumpy old man and his grumpier old dog to save the world from the Biblical Apocalypse.
column23: none

column14: A Pack of Misfits and Rebels book one
column17:
A young woman abandoned as a baby at a local Pack House is gifted to the King of the supernatural Kingdom of Midnight. Raised in servitude, and despite being a packless werewolf in a world ruled by vampires, she is determined to climb the ranks and establish her own legacy. Upon her twenty-first birthday, she gains her wolf and a disappointing but respectable position on the palace staff.
When celebrating at a local masquerade party with her friend, she meets a mysterious man she can't seem to resist. When he declares his intention of making her his, she will do anything to keep everything she has worked so hard to earn and the legacy she desires to leave behind. However, fate cares little for the plans of mortal minds, and the heart cares even less.
column18: All she wanted was to leave behind a new legacy, but all he wanted was her.
column23:
Origins Of A Queen

*Child Abuse (not on the page)

*Child Death (Mentioned in a historical sense)

*Gore

*curse words

*Emotional abuse (not perpetuated by the MMC to the FMC)

column14: The Oracle of Aeon Dra Saga
column17:
In the aftermath of the Xeonada Empire's destruction on Tellus, 20-year-old Melfina Aeon Dra narrowly escaped, only to find herself drawn back to her war-torn homeland to pursue her dream of becoming a certified Mecha Pilot with the revered Order. However, destiny takes an unexpected turn, leading her into the clutches of the enigmatic Order of the Dragon Knights, against the explicit warnings of her father and into the dangerous orbit of her mortal enemy, Prince Sixus Westin.

As the Oracle burdened with powers sought by all six kingdoms, Melfina must navigate the treacherous waters of political intrigue and deadly assassins who will stop at nothing to prevent her from succeeding at the Abraxas Institute of Union. With her dreams twisted into a nightmarish reality, Melfina discovers that piloting a deity in space is the least of her challenges. Forced to share a dorm room with Prince Sixus, the two must overcome their clashing personalities to survive not only the assassins, but also each other.

Embark on an exhilarating enemies to lovers new adult saga filled with pulse-pounding action, unexpected romance, intense violence, mature content, heart-wrenching moments, and mind-bending plot twists. Melfina and Sixus's journey will keep you on the edge of your seat, wondering what shocking revelation or unexpected turn awaits them next.
column18: The Oracle must die!
column23: Violence, profanity, spicy, death

column17:
After the heartbreaking loss of her mother, Emory Blair finds herself going through the motions of life, trapped between her grief and the pressure to follow in her father's footsteps by finishing college and going to medical school.

Torn with how quickly her father has moved on, Emory puts her feelings aside and attends his wedding, where she unexpectedly forms a romantic connection with her father's best friend, Jacob Young, a man twenty years her senior.

Determined to protect her father's emotions while trying to follow her own path, Emory must come to terms with the effect her relationship with Jake will have on her father's fragile heart and ultimately choose between the life her father wants her to live and the life she is desperate to live for herself.

T/W: Loss of a parent, fatal car accidents, and grief
column18: She was a grieving young woman on the brink of losing all hope until her father's best friend gave her a reason to feel alive again.
column23: Loss of a parent, fatal car accidents, and grief
column29: This book explores grief in losing a parent.

column17:
Marrying a Mafioso was just another duty Prima had to fulfill. Listen and obey was how she was raised. But getting kidnaped by a rival? Having his child? That wasn’t part of the deal. 

Nico DeLuca, a lifelong bachelor, owed Prima’s father a debt. Now, they are in a marriage neither of them wanted. 

With two children- a bastard son and a daughter Nico never wanted.
column18: Silent Prima Donna is a Historical Thriller that follows a young mother in an arranged marriage with a mafia leader, its fast paced, morally gray characters and survivor representation.

column17:
For countless years, Veronica Craine has roamed the earth, helping the vulnerable while battling her unquenchable craving for blood.
Under the cloak of darkness, she hunts relentlessly, vowing to vanquish every creature of the night that dares to cross her path.
With a menacing overlord commanding an army of the undead, Veronica is unwavering in her quest to end his evil reign.
column18: Born in agony, reborn in blood.
column23: Horror. Violence. 2 Moderate sexual scenes. Moderate Mental health struggles.

column17:
Andromeda just wanted a night to forget her problems. Now her one-night stand is her new client...and all hell is about to break loose.

It's been twenty years since the end of the world, and Andromeda Stirling is still trying to figure out her place in it.
A burnt-out interrogator for a mercenary group, Andromeda's skills are her ticket to staying alive. But when a brutal interrogation pushes her to the edge, she drowns her guilt in a one-night stand with Viktor Greaves.

She was never supposed to see him again. So, naturally, he hires her mercenary crew to find his missing family. He's willing to pay top dollar to keep her involved--and close. But as the two grow closer, the case spirals into bloodier territory and Andromeda makes a terrifying discovery--one that will change the course of her future.

Now, fighting for her life--and her heart--in a world she never prepared for, Andromeda must figure out how to save herself.

Because waiting for a hero has never been her style.
column18: Badass women, morally gray men, and the unconventional use of garlic rolls

column17:
I escaped from monsters and ran straight into the arms of my soulmate.
This new world is very different from the one that I know.  Beasts live within every person here and I am just a weak human who was given a one way ticket into this place and shook everything up.
I have magic in this world.
Powerful magic that was gifted by The Moon.  
Magic that can help my Mate and his people overcome a devastating obstacle that they are facing.
If, I can learn to control it.
But navigating this new world comes with its own challenges and not everyone is eager to accept me into the pack.
It isn’t long before I learn that someone’s bark can be just as dangerous as their bite.

Nightfang is the first book in the Moon Touched Chronicles trilogy.  Each book follows a different couple, but should be read in order.  The Moon Touched Chronicles feature protective wolf shifter MMCs and their human mates.  Mature content intended for readers 18+.
column18: Dragged into a shifter world by fate and moonlight, a human woman collides with her fated mate and awakens Moon Touched magic that changes everything.
column23:
This book contains strong language, sexually explicit scenes, primal play, discussions of drink tampering, violence, kidnapping, trafficking, child neglect, societal infertility, pregnancy, childbirth, and loss.

While this book does contain darker topics, the romance in this book is not dark.
column29: The series as a whole discusses mental health and disability representation but these themes are heavier in the later books.

column17:
I escaped from Hell and landed on my soulmate’s doorstep. After experiencing the unimaginable at the hands of monsters, I wake up in another world.  
	With the help of the woman who nursed me back to health, I avoided the witch hunters sweeping through the land and journeyed to the main village.  Bolstered by the rumors of a human living there, I storm into the Alpha’s lodge just in time to find my sister, Rowan, bleeding out on the floor.
	The desperate need to save her triggered something in me.  
Magic.  
Rare magic that The Moon blessed me with.
Incredible magic that can heal.  
	But that isn’t all that I discovered.
	My soulmate is here too.  
He is Alpha of the Nighthowl pack, and my sister’s new brother-in-law.  
Forced to live under the same roof, Griffin sees my fractured parts, and offers to help me carry the load.
Can I trust him with all of my demons?  
Together, can we mend what has been broken?

Nighthowl is the second book in the Moon Touched Chronicles trilogy.  Each book follows a different couple, but should be read in order.  The Moon Touched Chronicles feature protective wolf shifter MMCs and their human mates.  Mature content intended for readers 18+.
column18: Bound by The Moon and her fated mate, a human woman is thrown into a world of shifters where she must master her Moon Touched magic, confront the scars of her past, and stand against a rising threat determined to tear the pack apart.
column23:
This book contains strong language, sexually explicit scenes, discussions of sexual assault, drugging, violence, self-harm, panic attacks, kidnapping, trafficking, child neglect, societal infertility, pregnancy, childbirth, and loss.

Ramsey is a survivor.  While her experiences are discussed and shown via nightmares, the assault happened prior to her arriving in this world and is not at the hands of our MMC.  Griffin is a supportive partner who loves Ramsey through her healing.
column29: The series as a whole discusses mental health themes as well as disability representation. Nighthowl, specifically, discusses anxiety, panic, PTSD, and mental illness.

column12: Soapy Sally and the Cousin Crew: Legacy of Bubble Fox Hollow
column17:
To save the magic, they must first discover the truth…

Every family has a story—
But five young cousins never imagined theirs was a legend.

What begins as an ordinary vacation to their grandmother’s house turns extraordinary when a shattered mirror reveals a portal to Bubble Fox Hollow, a hidden world where magic once flowed freely but is now slipping away.

Inside this breathtaking realm, the Cousin Crew meets Soapy Sally, a mischievous fox with shimmering fur and secrets older than the Hollow itself. Through riddles, clues, sparkles, and the help of new friends they meet along the way, she guides them on a quest to recover what was lost and uncover a truth that ties their family to the survival of an entire magical world.

But time is running out.
Magic is fading.
And on both sides of the glass, old wounds must be mended before Bubble Fox Hollow can be saved.

The fate of Soapy Sally and her enchanted world rests in their hands… and only courage, love, and unbreakable family bonds can restore what was broken long ago.

Perfect for readers who love:
• Cozy, whimsical fantasy adventures
• Brave kids solving magical mysteries
• Strong family relationships
• Talking creatures, riddles, and enchanted forests
• Worlds full of wonder, humor, and heart
• Middle-grade fantasy that feels warm, magical, and cinematic

Enter a world of magic, family, and courage.
Soapy Sally and the Cousin Crew: Legacy of Bubble Fox Hollow launches a magical new middle-grade fantasy series about the power of love, the strength of family, and the courage to face the truth—even when it shatters everything you thought you knew.

Find the courage. Follow the clues. Step through the mirror.
column18: To save the magic, they must first discover the truth…
column23: NA

column17:
Amethyst Gold has a plan: keep to herself, keep her a roof over her head, and keep her two overachieving cattle dogs from running the whole show.

Then a man named Loki starts “coincidentally” appearing in her small-town life, and strange glowing runes begin seem to be everywhere —leaving Amethyst to decide which is scarier: the impossible patterns in the pines, or how much she wants the one person who seems tied to all of it.
column18: A magic-averse woman and the chaos god who can’t stay away from her must decide if falling in love is worth breaking the world a little more.
column23:
•	Past family death (off-page; referenced trauma and grief).
•	Anxiety, panic, and self-doubt; fear of “going crazy.”
•	Government surveillance/harassment and containment-style threat.
•	Intense peril and siege scenes (guns drawn, characters thrown by magic, fear for life).
•	On-page sexual content between consenting adults; explicit language.

column17:
When CIA officer Lex Jackson is dispatched to Copenhagen, his mission is clear: uncover who's behind White Nights—a shadowy organization bent on toppling the U.S. president.
But as the body count rises and a mole is exposed deep inside the CIA, Jackson finds himself the next target on a ruthless assassin's list. Across the globe, Roald Popov, a former KGB black operative, uncovers explosive intel: the Russian Federation has planted sleeper cells inside the highest levels of the U.S. and Canadian governments. But when his cover is blown, Popov must escape Russia and protect his daughter and deliver the truth—before it's buried forever.  As Jackson and Popov race against time from Copenhagen to St. Petersburg, the fate of two nations hang in balance.
column18: Trust on one
column23: None

column17:
Layla has a family who loves her—including fiercely protective older brothers who’ve kept her from making mistakes, but also her own choices. When she starts dating their best friend, they back off for the first time, giving her room to breathe but also making her less cautious. After a terrifying and nearly tragic encounter while she’s out alone, her parents hire a bodyguard.
Jamie is more than happy to accept the job. Not only does it give him the routine he craves, he enjoys spending time with Layla a little too much. Although their chemistry is immediate, loving her isn’t a risk he’s prepared to take. Experience has taught him it always leads to disappointment or pain.
Though they deny it, and Layla’s father forbids it, they fall hard for each other.
But fear keeps them apart. She finds herself in a new relationship she didn’t want and he realizes he’s found a family he’ll do anything to keep.
Take It Back Then features some strong language and explicit sex scenes, as well as scenes involving kidnapping, SA intent, and death that can be upsetting or triggering to some.
column18: They’re forbidden from being together, but that only makes them fall faster.
column23: Take It Back Then features some strong language and explicit sex scenes, as well as scenes involving kidnapping, SA intent, and death that can be upsetting or triggering to some.

column17:
Adrian
All my life, I hungered for the love my parents had before they died too early. Instead, I’ve been ruling over my pack since I was seven. I’ve done a good job. We’re the strongest and wealthiest pack on the North American continent.
But still… I’ve often wondered… will I die alone? 
Everything changes when a feeling grows in me one super moon. Despite my pack thinking I’ve finally lost it, I chase it. 
And there, in the woods, I find her. My mate, my Luna, but why is she with the Beta from Crescent Moon? Why does she reject me and only trust him?
Amelia
All my life, they’ve tried to beat me down because I am not like them. I’ve had to work ten times harder, be ten times better, try to gain their approval but they’ll never accept me. They think I’m worthless and will stop at nothing to try to make me feel the same, so today I’m leaving. 
Despite their Alpha being my mate, despite the physical pain I’ll feel, I’m leaving. All I need is my brother, Simon. He’s the only one that matters.
column18: ”I’ll lay your enemies by your feet.”

column12: The Prince of Shadows (and His Spark among His Ashes)
column14: A Burning Heart, and a Moonlit Spark, Book1
column15: Romance, Dark Romance, Thriller, Mystery, Contemporary, YA
column17:
He was the first boy who ever saw her—not her family's name, not her illness, just her. 
He was also the heir to a criminal empire he was sworn to destroy.

Nora Kingston knows the rules: trust no one, protect your family’s reputation, and never let them see you falter. Living with a hidden medical condition in the glittering, gossip-fueled world of Port Carmine is a constant high-wire act. Her only solace is her three enigmatic friends—the Ashlin cousins, with their sharp smiles, sharper tongues, and a loyalty that feels like a fortress.

Especially her boyfriend, Victor. The quiet artist who became her anchor. 
The boy who vanished without a word for two years.

Now he’s back. Taller, harder, with a storm in his eyes that wasn’t there before. 
He says he left to protect her. He says his dangerous family was the reason. Nora wants to believe him, wants to lose herself in the future they’re finally building.

But when a chilling encounter reveals the terrifying truth, Nora’s world shatters. 
Victor isn’t just from a bad family. He’s the reluctant heir to the most feared syndicate in the city. And he’s not running from his legacy—he’s leading a secret war from the shadows to burn it all down.

He lied to keep her safe. Now, his enemies know she’s his only weakness.

Caught in the crossfire of a hidden war, Nora must make an impossible choice. Walk away from the only love she’s ever known, or step into the darkness beside him. But in a world where loyalty is bought with blood and love is the ultimate target, the wrong choice could destroy them both.
column18: Protection can feel a lot like betrayal, when he knocks her out to save her life, and she wakes up in his real world.
column19: Mental health themes, Disability representation, Cultural / ethnic diversity
column23: Violence (non-graphic), threats, implied child abuse, implied child neglect, organized crime, kidnapping, drugging/sedation, injury, emotional trauma, chronic illness, medical emergencies, betrayal themes.

column17: Follow Josephine as she moves back to her hometown with an attitude of anything for the plot. Reconnecting with ex lovers, friends and foes slowly spirals and the casual cruelty of the town’s citizens starts to show.
column18: A story where casual and cruel goes hand in hand
column23: Violence, untreated mental health issues and murders

column17:
Bullied to the brink of death by his family, unloved and weary of life, Samuel plans to end it under the Greek summer sun. That is until one morning he meets a fisherman, with eyes like the sea. Separated by continents and status, Samuel and Nikos wrestle their differences, despair, a deep shared grief, and despite all, love ignites in their lonely hearts.
But will that scorching love be enough to carry them through the obstacles in their path or will it burn them to a crisp under that white sun?
column18: I wanted to die under that summer sun.

column12: For Everything There Is a Season
column17:
For Everything There Is a Season takes a deep dive into the dysfunction of the Miller Family and explores the idea that anyone can be both villain and victim and there's not always a tidy ending.

As if dealing with the death of their older brother Marcus wasn't enough, now Anna, Carmen and Danny find themselves trapped in a time loop, having to relive the week of his death over and over. In an effort to end the recurrence, they're forced to work together to determine the solution.
column18: Three siblings journey to escape their morbid time loop is full of confrontations, heartache, and self-discovery.
column23: Child SA, Addiction, Emotional Abuse

column17:
At eight years old, Nasya Ember was sold into a mysterious organization called The Order. She and several other girls were taken and trained by a group of women known as The Mothers. Training was extreme. The Mothers were ruthless. The girls who graduated from training were lethal. And for Nasya, training did more than prepare her to become a Hand of The Order. Each step forward in training awakened new things from inside of her, things neither she nor The Mothers can completely explain. Her search for answers runs parallel to her life within The Order. 

Will she choose power? 
Will she choose love? 
Or will other forces work against her?
column18: Cinderella goes to the ball to kill the prince.
column23:
Children trained to be assassins involving dark themes and violence 
Violence

column17:
After being uprooted from my life on the south side, I was thrown head-first into a run-down house in the north. We were barely getting by. Mom was bedridden most of the time, my sister helped take care of our younger siblings when needed, and I was going to a nice college off a scholarship I’d earned.

Everything came crashing down around me when my ex-boyfriend decided to return to Brookhaven with his two best friends in tow—friends who hated me just as prominently as he did. If that wasn’t the icing on the freaking cake, they have made it their mission to break me, to destroy me, to take everything from me.

Ashton. The boy who had convinced himself and his friends that I’d betrayed him. The one who might have been the most ruthless of them all.

Jameson. His best friend who had also become mine. Yet, there was always something more between us. A blurred line that we’d tiptoed around on more than one occasion.

Kash. The one who chose to keep his distance, scared to confront the scorching attraction between the two of us. He’d been more of an acquaintance to me, but also a friend in his own, distant way.

They want to see me break, to paint themselves in my despair and watch as I begged for a mercy none of them were keen on granting.

They think they know the truth. But they only know the lie. A lie that’s going to set us all aflame.
column18: When your ex becomes your nightmare
column23: Mental health representation, dubious consent, SA, severe bullying, death of a parent, cheating, prostitution, betrayal, slight miscommunication, morally gray MMCs.

column14: Heir of the Promise: Book One
column17:
Shem, son of Noah, spends his days working on his father's ranch nestled in the beautiful foothills near the town of Ararat. Yet living in the shadow of a prophecy that Yahweh's judgement is imminent leaves Shem feeling trapped in the endless cycle of duty and tradition.
His world is shattered when murderous invaders and a monstrous
Nephilim descend upon the once-peaceful town, changing his life forever. Armed with an age-old sword of Eden, he sets out on a dangerous quest for revenge, leaving behind all he's ever known.
Thrust into a treacherous world, he grapples with inner doubts and fears while facing an enemy that is bent on defying the Creator Himself.
Will Shem learn to harness the full potential of The Sword of the Spirit
before it's too late?
column18: Haunted by prophecy and shattered by loss, Shem, son of Noah, must overcome doubt and fear to wield a sacred sword against the rising darkness.
column23: Violence

column12: Double-Crossed An Officer Rayna Gavi Story
column17: Officer Rayna Gavi is like any other police officer, just trying to make a difference. She is good at her job and ambitious. When she finally decides to get on a game-changing case involving a serial killer terrorizing the city, will it help her advance like she wants, or take her down a dangerous path. Will the case be as simple as just catching the bad guy, or is something else going on?
column18: “Don’t move,” Lukas grits through his clenched teeth, his hand wrapped around my throat.
column23: Violence

column17: Grace Wright came to live with her aunt in the small town of Kent, following the tragic loss of her parents. Hoping for a fresh start, while adjusting to rural town living, the last thing she expected was a spectral killer dressed as the local high school mascot, targeting the young people of the town. Reliance on technology, and instant communication in the palm of our hand begs the question, what happens when the only way to call for help, is to scream... and hope someone is listening.
column18: Pep Rallies, Parades, Hometown Games, school spirit and murder. It’s Homecoming in the small, rural town of Kent.
column23: Harsh language and graphic depictions of bullying, Physical violence and murder.

column17:
When an accident strands James in an alien world of endless grasslands and stalking predators, he's left with nothing but his will to survive.

Alone, hungry, and hunted, his odds are razor-thin.

Driven by sheer determination, James claws his way back from the edge of starvation until he crosses paths with a battle-hardened trader with violence carved into his past and power bound into his skin.

Under Dayne's guidance, James begins to transform from desperate survivor to determined apprentice, finding purpose in this harsh new reality.

But when northern raiders threaten the settlements and war looms on the horizon, James faces an impossible choice: keep searching for a way back to a world that may no longer exist, or embrace the strength this harsh realm demands and fight for the life he's building.

In a world where survival isn't enough, who will James choose to become?

Lost Between Twin Moons is the first book in a dark fantasy series where growth is earned through suffering and strength is forged from loss. Perfect for readers who love gritty world-building, gut-wrenching stakes, and protagonists who are broken before they can rise.

Fair warning: This is Book 1 of a slow-burn transformation arc. James's journey to power begins with devastation.
column18: Find a way home or survive long enough to make this world home.
column23: Violence

column17: No one really knows what happens after you die. What if, instead of eternal reward or eternal punishment, it's much more nuanced and uncertain? What if you could still watch over your loved ones in a direct and meaningful way? What if you could get revenge on those that wronged you? Maybe you just want to cause confusion or wonder. This is what I explore in my Spirit Saga. Human spirits can see through time, and use the information to influence the living in the present. However, everything isn't all peaceful among spirits. Our main character finds himself embroiled in a spiritual war, and for reasons no one will tell him, both sides are trying to recruit him. All he really wants though is to be able to protect the family he left behind.
column18: Death is the start of a new existence, but your life can still catch up with you.
column23: Alcoholism and drunk driving; graphic scenes of pain, gore, and death; abduction, domestic abuse, and implied sexual assault.

column17:
BLACK ROSE is a sweeping tale of love, loss, and immortality—a dual-timeline vampire romance following one woman’s struggle between independence and desire.

1891: Broken by grief, Rose is drawn into the alluring world of Draven, the charming and secretive man who saves her life. Within the candlelit halls of Thornwood Manor, she must navigate her sorrow, the whispers of town gossip, and the dangerous pull of a love she cannot escape.

2010: Over a century later, Rose walks the world as a Vampire—independent, untethered, and alone. That is, until New Year’s Eve brings her to Lakeview, where her former best friend, Vail, begs for help. Vampires are vanishing without a trace. When Rose meets Connor, a seemingly ordinary man she seduces for answers, she vows to keep her true nature hidden. But the past she’s buried is rising again—and Connor may have secrets of his own.
column18: BLACK ROSE is a sweeping tale of love, loss, and immortality—a dual-timeline vampire romance following one woman’s struggle between independence and desire.
column23: Death, grief, blood, drugs, addiction

column12: Guardians of Alistile: Risen from Ash
column17:
“What do you want, Little Flame?”
It was a question Kienna never dared to ask.
Raised behind the impenetrable Orb of River Storm, Kienna is destined to serve and protect her city as the Starborn from the evil festering beyond the barrier after the War of Liberation. She, and four other Guardians, are gifted magic by the great and powerful King Vaerin.
Then Kienna discovers the king’s secret and throws his gift back in his face.
When River Storm’s lies shatter, Kienna makes the impossible choice to help a rebel army tear down the Orb and run. She never expected the other Guardians to follow. Now, hunted and broken, they discover a world far different than the one they were taught to fear. A world that forces them to question everything, including themselves.
As loyalties fracture, and kingdoms prepare for war, Kienna must decide who she truly is: the obedient weapon the king forged…or the flame that will burn his empire to ash.
column18: Kienna must decide who she truly is: the obedient weapon the king forged…or the flame that will burn his empire to ash.
column23:
Narcissistic abuse
War, death, and gore

column17:
Calli's whole life has been about survival.

Being on your own in a post-apocalyptic wasteland can do that to a girl. So when a gorgeous stranger offers her food and a place to stay in exchange for help around his colony's farm, she's hardly in a position to say no. The farm may be her chance to finally have someplace permanent to call home. But the seemingly idyllic town has secrets, and it soon becomes clear that not everyone here is happy with her arrival….

As the leader of his people, Matt has always been strict about ensuring no one learns too much about who - and what - they are. The second he meets Calli, his carefully constructed rules no longer apply. Calli is his - he's as sure of it as his wolf is. Matt's need to protect her is tested as Calli's own past threatens to haunt her…and someone lurking in the shadows promises to destroy them both.
column18: She was running for her life when she found a town full of secrets and a man who claimed her as his mate.

column17: After a tragic loss, Savannah Sinclair disappears—only to learn that some legacies refuse to stay buried. When a mysterious man enters her life, secrets unravel, danger returns, and love might cost her everything.
column18: You can only run for so long....before the past finds you.
column23: All of the things....domestic violence, emotional and physical abuse, PTSD and Trauma recovery, kidnapping, adult language, human trafficking, torture and graphic violence, murder

column17:
For readers who love slow-burn mystery, gothic atmosphere, and unreliable narrators

The dead don’t steal. They trade.

Every Samhain, Isolde “Izzy” Vela leaves the same offerings on her family’s graves: mezcal, rosemary, a cigarette, and a letter she never sends. She knows the rules—never ask for more than one secret, never read the book aloud, never check the graves at dawn—but this year, the dead are greedy. The offerings vanish before midnight. The Book of Given Names writes itself in her ancestors’ handwriting, its pages filled with confessions that rewrite her memories. And the black marigolds on Luz’s grave bloom only for those who don’t know they’re dead.

When a skeptical journalist, Dante Morales, arrives to expose the town’s “haunted” tourism scams, he catches Izzy pulling a locket from her sister’s sealed casket. But the real fraud isn’t the graves—it’s the lie Izzy tells herself to keep breathing. Because the Collector is coming for the last piece of her: the name she buried herself under.

Now, with the book’s ink bleeding into her veins and the tide pools whispering in a language only she understands, Izzy must decide: Is she the girl who drowned, the ghost who got away, or the monster the dead made her?

A haunting, lyrical tale of memory as currency, grief as a bargain, and the lies we tell to stay alive—even when we’re not.
column18: The dead don’t steal. They trade
column23: Drowning & Suffocation, Body Horror & Transformation, Self-Harm Imagery, Psychological Manipulation & Gaslighting, Grief & Traumatic Loss, Supernatural Coercion, Existential Dread & Identity Collapse, Horror Elements

column12: Grimtome: Quest of the Book Goblin
column14: Chronicles of Time series. Dalen Pax
column17: Grimtome, everyone's favorite Book Goblin becomes self aware to the point he knows he is in a book. Now, with the help of Rumplestiltskin and the reader (you) that he lovingly calls Bob, he sets out to prove that he can be a hero eventhough he was written as a servant to evil, so that he can earn is chance to escape the fictional book he is trapped in. Follow Grimtome as he jumps from one fairytale to the next in search of the items that will prove his worth and help him find the family that he never knew he needed or even wanted.
column18: Goblin Deadpool meets warehouse 13 told as only a villainous goblin hero could tell it.
column23: There is some violence torture, and sexual conversations and suggestions, including same sex and references to nonconsensual sex, based off of the original fairytales such as Sleeping Beauty and Snow-white

column12: The Nine Realms, Records of Realms Book One
column17:
Centrea is a mystery to all, including herself.

Waking in an illustrious estate, Centrea cannot recall who she is nor how she appeared on the snowy outskirts of the Ice Realm. The Lord of the Estate is quick to bring the remarkable beauty under his wing as she learns about both this world and herself. In the months she spends there, Centrea attempts to navigate the stringent political and social systems embedded within the realm. Along the way, she forges a life filled with quirky friends, hours of writing, and an ill-advised romance with her mysterious host.

Though, not all is as it seems. Centrea hears whispers of a war raging nearby. As the traditional Greentime Ball grows closer, she learns of an underground movement popular amongst the lowly Keeper class that supports a rising King of the Star Realm. Centrea must leverage her position as the Lord’s favorite to seek what is right while carving out a space for herself in the powerful Realm.

Will Centrea find who she was? Or, perhaps more importantly, will she find who she is meant to be?
column18: The Nine Realms is a romantic fantasy about a woman who loses her memories, indulges in a forbidden romance with an Ice Realm Lord, and attends a Ball that changes her life forever.
column23: Dubious consent, violence, sexually mature content.

column17:
A dark paranormal romcom about how our person doesn’t always make sense, they just fit.

Sloane controls every aspect of Archer’s life, and he does anything to make her happy.
After a mishap that takes Archer to the spirit world, he continues to play with her in any way he can.
Returning to a life without her person, Sloane does the best she can until they meet again.
—Read my book b!tches.
column18: Perfect for Readers Who Love Dark rom-coms that veer into “WTF did I just read?” territory.

column17: At the backdrop of a small town filled with cherished memories and mining the depths of human resilience lies the tale of Troy Parker and Melissa Jensen, two individuals bound by a single kiss but separated by the passage of time and life’s myriad challenges. Ten years after a poignant farewell on the beach during their high school graduation, both characters embark on journeys shaped by personal struggles, societal expectations, and a longing for connection. With Troy back home—a famous movie star seeking refuge from the chaos of a scandal—and Melissa navigating the complexities of single motherhood and familial responsibilities, their story unfolds as a poignant reminder of love’s enduring nature.
column18: Do you remember that first kiss?
column23: N/A

column17:
Seren has lived countless lives, each one ending tragically before she can uncover the truth about her existence. Reincarnated time and time again, she is haunted by fragments of memories and the shadow of a prophecy that has placed a target on her back. The Ancient Ones, fearful of her potential to fulfill this prophecy, want her dead.

In the heart of this turmoil stands Daemon, the dark and mysterious god of the sun, whose love for Seren spans lifetimes. His intense passion and unwavering devotion clash with the gentle, enigmatic presence of Finn, a soul who has also loved Seren through her many incarnations. Each man offers her a different path, but the choice is far from clear.

Torn between the consuming love of Daemon and the comforting, steady affection of Finn, Seren must navigate a world of danger and deception. She uncovers the reasons behind the Ancient Ones' fear and the true nature her rencarnations.

Can both men help her uncover the truth of the prophecy and stop the cycle of destruction and torment, or will one of them be her undoing?"
"Starlight Destiny" is an urban fantasy set in Puerto Rico, with gods and mortals, a plucky familiar, some spice and love that survives the ages.
column18: They call her the cursebreaker—but if she fails this life, the stars themselves will fall.

column12: On the Vampire's Couch: A Couch of Anguish and Blood
column17: Follows the life of Elias, a 400-year old vampire trying to live at peaceand forget the wars of his past. He loves to collect nice couches, but keeps losing them when he brings dates by, and his hunger takes over.
column18: An Indigenous South American vampire and his morally-grey devil on the shoulder best friend navigate life in a big city.
